job_title: Human Resources Director in Bountiful, UT
pros: Benefits and caring administration, flexible work/life balance
cons: Healthcare can be demanding, long hours

The scheduling department pawns its entire job off onto all the employees. Saying that you arn’t allowed to request time off. They also are very unwilling to work with your school schedule. They will also put you on the schedule when you are not supposed to be at work. There is no reason to even have a scheduling department with what they make you do so they don’t have to do anything. If you work on night shift the management doesn’t care about your shift at all. No concerns will be addressed and they will not respond to your emails or otherwise form of communication regarding anything anything that would make them stay longer than their 40hr work week. CNA’s especially are treated horribly. On their LTAC unit RNs, RTs medics are paid differentials for just working on the unit but CNAs are less valuable to them so we do not get that sort of benefit. Management will never give you a raise don’t bother asking you will just be blatantly ignored and act like you are a very unimportant part of the functions of the facility.

review_title: Not the best place for someone to work
pros: I absolutely loved my patients! They are the only reason I stayed there as long as I did.
cons: There was no chance of getting a raise. They lowered my pay without telling me about it. the managers and supervisors are so petty. They constantly belittled the rest of us, sometimes in front of clients. They had their favorites that they allowed to do anything, but if they didn't like you they would do everything they could to make you miserable.  I complained to HR about a few situations and nothing ever came of it. I took a pay cut when I left there, but I'm much happier in a place where I feel valued and respected.

review_title: Worst working experience could of ever had.
pros: Most of the employees were great to work with.
cons: you always have to be on your toe's, never know what type of attitude supervisers and managers will be in. They treated my fellow employees and I like dirt and call us names like Dumb*** and so on. Superviser and managers had favorites they would talk bad about certain employees to their favorites. No one here knows how to keep it quite. Everyone knows everything personal stories, why that person was fired or why that person is not liked.

review_title: Has it's good things and bad things about it.
pros: They have pretty good insurance and supervisors are very willing to work with you if you need time off quickly.
cons: Managers don't really talk to the staff about important issues and it leads to people being confused about what they can or can't do.

pros: The schedule is unbeatable and salary is competitive.  It's an easy going place and staff are always willing to help each other out. I got to learn a LOT, and got to work with a ton of different patients with a wide variety of diagnoses.
cons: There can be a disconnect between administration and floor staff, but I have seen significant improvements in this area over the last year.

pros: I love working at South Davis! The staff is so friendly and they work around your schedule. really well!
cons: I can’t really think of any cons! There are some rough days but any job is going to have some down days!

review_title: Worked with lots of fun people, but it was emotionally hard.
pros: Fun people to work with, both patients and staff. Great pay for a CNA.
cons: Physically taxing for a person small of stature. Emotionally hard when a string of deaths occurs.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Orem, UT
pros: Tuition reimbursement, 401K with match, PTO, flexible scheduling and skills, skills, skills, new grads will learn so much here.
cons: So far so good. I cannot complain.
